column5: TOKYO Olympus Corp's ousted CEO Michael Woodford said on Tuesday the firm's main banker and major shareholder Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group had declined his request for a meeting.

column4: Olympus ex-CEO Woodford: firm's main bank SMFG has declined meeting
column5: TOKYO  Dec 20 Olympus Corp's  ousted CEO Michael Woodford said on Tuesday the firm's main banker and major shareholder Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group  had declined his request for a meeting.

column4: U.S. adds 10 companies in Malta to Iran sanctions
column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. Treasury Department said on Tuesday it was expanding sanctions on Iran to include 10 "shipping and front companies and one individual based in Malta" affiliated with the Islamic Republic of Iran Shipping Lines (IRISL).

column4: UPDATE 1-AES  Oyak to develop coal project in Turkey
column5: Dec 20 The AES Corp said its joint venture with Turkey's Koç Holding has agreed to develop a coal project in south east Turkey along with Oyak  the country's largest pension fund.

column4: RBS to sell $2.1 bln property loan portfolio-source
column5: LONDON  Dec 20 Royal Bank of Scotland  is poised to sell a 1.36 billion pound ($2.1 billion) property loan portfolio to a fund managed by Blackstone  as it battles to retreat from riskier real estate lending  a person familiar with the deal told Reuters.

column4: Google  TransCanada set solar plant deals
column5: Google Inc and TransCanada Corp announced deals to buy solar power projects on Tuesday  just days after billionaire Warren Buffett made his second major purchase in the sector.

column4: TransCanada to buy Ontario solar projects from Canadian Solar
column5: TransCanada Corp said it agreed to buy 86 megawatt of solar power projects in Ontario from a unit of panel maker Canadian Solar Inc for $470 million.

column4: UPDATE 1-TransCanada to buy Ontario solar projects from Canadian Solar
column5: Dec 20 TransCanada Corp said it agreed to buy 86 megawatt of solar power projects in Ontario from a unit of panel maker Canadian Solar Inc for $470 million.

column4: Analysis: United Tech CEO sharpens portfolio-pruning shears
column5: BOSTON As United Technologies Corp  gets ready to close the biggest takeover in its history  Goodrich Corp   CEO Louis Chenevert is scouring the diversified manufacturer's portfolio for businesses to sell.

column4: Investor to Vulcan: consider Martin Marietta bid
column5: One of Vulcan Materials'  largest shareholders urged the company to seriously consider accepting Martin Marietta Materials'  hostile bid of nearly $5 billion for the producer of sand  gravel and other construction materials.

column4: Report card 2011: Disney moved to cut costs with fewer films
column5: LOS ANGELES (TheWrap.com) - This is the sixth in TheWrap's series of Studio Report Cards.
